title: Petition to make Taliyah ult not get stopped by Yasuo Windwall
body: I get it, no one plays taliyah and hurr durr they are never going to nerf yasuo but why is this a thing.  Why was the ult coded like this? The ult doesnt do damage nor cause any crazy threat to yasuo

replies.body:
https://youtu.be/eLxcTFONWz0?t=16s

You can also help Yasuo kill your team!
I like the enthusiastic "WA HOO!" she gives after sending Ashe to die.
That distinctly is a bug then that should be reported, because no ally applied CC should ever enable Yas (Blast Cone, Trundle Pillar, Anivia wall, ect)

Definitely unintended, but I don't think it's a bug. Strictly peaking. (Should still be reported.)

Yas ult was coded too work off any displacement, *then* self-displacements were changed to not count as airborne.

Since the displacement isn't coming from Ashe, it Probably still has the "airborne" tag. This should be tested with Anivia and Trundle for consistency.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G1lWCt3a-UE
While I agree it's bullshit (well, Yasuo's windwall is bullshit on its own), I think it's because it still displaces Yasuo thus being a threat, since it applies crowd-control.

To be completely honest I'm not sure if it's even intentional. My money is that it's just how the code is and changing the code would require resources that they don't want to spend on something as small as this. I mean yes this can be a big deal but how often does it happen? You'd have to have an ally Taliyah and an enemy Yasuo and she'd have to ult into his wind wall. It happens but I doubt it's on their to-do list
To be completely honest even If it's unintentional, Riot doesn't have problem turning bugs (since they tend to refer to unintentional behaviour as bug) into "mechanics" :D

But yeah fuck his wall, it's got no business being up for so long after he uses it.  At least champs like Braum are centered around doing that.  And champs like sivir and nocturne have to time their spellshields just right in the heat of battle.

> The ult doesnt do damage nor cause any crazy threat to yasuo

It isn't stopped because it does damage or is a threat, it is stopped because it is an effect, that has a travel time, that happens to leave a wall behind it. The fact that it has a travel time(and is not a unit) means it is a projectile, which is stopped by wind wall and unbreakable. They didn't rewrite the code to specifically exclude that interaction, because it would be more work for... is there even any payoff here? And look at it from the opposite end, if your change went though, would it fair that Taliyah should be able to construct a wall over half of the map without any way to counteract it? No, it wouldn't.

Not to mention, as far as lore goes, Yasuo trained Taliyah. Surely in the months he trained her, he learned a few tricks that allowed him to counteract her actions.

Also.....how many times in the Taliyah vs Yasuo game is he going to be in a position TO windwall it? 1 in 50? If you are using your wall as Taliyah 99% of the time you aren't going to be shooting it through Yasuo to even get it windwalled.
